intro: Sphacele cochabambana, commonly known as the Cochabamba thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Bolivia. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in high-altitude regions of the Andes. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
